summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued to Jean Luc Brunel by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding his appearance on July 24, 2019, to testify regarding alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and related statutes. The document includes an advice of rights and a request to keep the subpoena confidential.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.role: Subpoena recipient / potential witness or subject
persons.context: The individual commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce documents in connection with an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking laws.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the subpoena and the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a grand jury subpoena to Brunel, compelling his testimony and document production.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance of Jean Luc Brunel
events.description: Jean Luc Brunel is commanded to appear before a federal grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and give evidence.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The subpoena and accompanying confidentiality request letter are dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jean Luc Brunel was subpoenaed to appear before a federal grand jury on July 24, 2019, in the Southern District of New York.

The investigation concerns alleged violations of federal statutes including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421, 2422, 2423 (transportation for prostitution, coercion, and child sexual activity), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that Brunel voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The subpoena includes an 'Advice of Rights' informing Brunel of his right against self-incrimination and right to counsel.
